name: hybrid-analysis
label: Hybrid Analysis
description: Hybrid Analysis provides malware analysis service. This connector facilitates automated operations such as get report, environment, submit file, submit URL, etc.

fields.title: Server URL
fields.name: server_url
fields.description: URL of the Hybrid Analysis server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.

fields.title: API Key
fields.name: api_key
fields.description: API key that is configured for your account to access the Hybrid Analysis endpoint.

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not.

operations.title: Get Analysis Report for Multiple Hashcodes
operations.description: Retrieves the analysis report summary from the Hybrid Analysis server for multiple MD5/SHA1/SHA256 hash codes you have specified.

parameters.title: Hash Codes
parameters.name: hashcodes
parameters.tooltip: Either one md5/sha1/sha256 hash or several of them in CSV format
parameters.description: Specify the hash codes in the MD5, SHA256, or SHA1 format whose summary you want to retrieve from the Hybrid Analysis server. You can specify multiple codes in the CSV format.

operations.title: Get Environment
operations.description: Retrieves all the sandbox information from the Hybrid Analysis server.

operations.title: Submit File
operations.description: Submits a file from the FortiSOAR™ Attachments module to the Hybrid Analysis server for analysis.

parameters.title: Attachment ID
parameters.name: value
parameters.description:
The ID of the file that you want to submit to the Hybrid Analysis server. The file ID is used to access the file from the 'Attachments' module of FortiSOAR™.
In the playbook, the value of the attachment ID field defaults to {{vars.attachment_id}}.

parameters.title: Environment ID
parameters.name: environment_id
parameters.tooltip: e.g 300: 'Linux (Ubuntu 16.04, 64 bit)', 200: 'Android Static Analysis’
parameters.description:
The ID of the environment in which the file is to be run.
For example, 300: 'Linux (Ubuntu 16.04, 64 bit)', 200: 'Android Static Analysis’.
Available environment IDs are: 300: 'Linux (Ubuntu 16.04, 64 bit)', 200: 'Android Static Analysis’, 120: 'Windows 7 64 bit’, 110: 'Windows 7 32 bit (HWP Support)', or 100: ‘Windows 7 32 bit’.

parameters.title: Do Not Share with Third Party?
parameters.name: no_share_third_party
parameters.tooltip: When set to 'true’, the sample is never shared with any third party
parameters.description:
If you select this option, i.e. set it to True; then this sample is not shared with any third party.
By default, this is set to, True.

parameters.title: Do Not Lookup with Hash?
parameters.name: no_hash_lookup
parameters.tooltip: When set to 'true’, we can not lookup with hash
parameters.description:
If you select this option, i.e. set it to True; then this sample is not looked up using its hash value.
By default, this is set to, False.

parameters.title: Priority
parameters.name: priority
parameters.tooltip: Priority value between 0 (default) and 100 (highest)
parameters.description: The priority value of the sample. By default, the Priority is set to, 0. You can set this value to any value between 0 and 100, which is the highest value.

parameters.title: Action Script
parameters.name: action_script
parameters.tooltip: Custom runtime action script. Available runtime scripts are following
parameters.description: (Optional) Select a custom runtime action script.Available custom runtime action script are as follows: default, default_maxantievasion, default_randomfiles, default_randomtheme, or default_openie.

parameters.title: Required Memory Dump?
parameters.name: hybrid_analysis
parameters.tooltip: When set to 'false’, no memory dumps or memory dump analysis will take place
parameters.description: If you select this option, i.e set it to,True then memory dumps or memory analysis dumps will occur.By default, this is set to, True.

parameters.title: Experimental Anti-Evasion?
parameters.name: experimental_anti_evasion
parameters.tooltip: When set to 'true’, will set all experimental anti-evasion options of the kernelmode Monitor
parameters.description: If you select this option, i.e set it to, True,enables all the experimental anti-evasion options of the kernelmode Monitor.By default, this is set toFalse

parameters.title: Set the IN-Depth Script Logging
parameters.name: script_logging
parameters.tooltip: When set to 'true’, will set the in-depth script logging engine of the kernelmode Monitor
parameters.description: If you select this option, i.e set it to,True enables the in-depth script logging engine of the kernelmode Monitor.By default, this is set to, False.

parameters.title: Allow Sample Tampering
parameters.name: input_sample_tampering
parameters.tooltip: When set to 'true’, will allow experimental anti-evasion options of the kernelmode Monitor that tamper with the input sample
parameters.description: If you select this option, i.e set it to,True enables the experimental anti-evasion options of the kernelmode Monitor that tamper with the input sample.By default, this is set to, False.

parameters.title: Enabled TOR Analysis?
parameters.name: tor_enabled_analysis
parameters.tooltip: When set to 'true’, will route the network traffic for the analysis via TOR (if properly configured on the server)
parameters.description: If you select this option, i.e set it to, True, the network traffic for the analysis is routed using TOR (if it is properly configured on the server.By default, this is set to, True.

parameters.title: Offline Analysis
parameters.name: offline_analysis
parameters.tooltip: When set to “true”, will disable outbound network traffic for the guest VM (takes precedence over ‘tor_enabled_analysis’ if both are provided)
parameters.description: If you select this option, i.e set it to, True, the outbound network traffic for the guest VM is disabled. The value that you set for this field takes precedence over the value that you have set for the 'Enabled TOR Analysis?' field, in case you have specified both the values.By default, this is set to, False.

parameters.title: Email Notification
parameters.name: email
parameters.tooltip: E-Mail address that may be associated with the submission for notification
parameters.description: (Optional) Email Address that is associated with the file that you have submitted for submission. This email address will be used for notification purposes.

parameters.title: Properties File with VxStream Directives
parameters.name: properties
parameters.tooltip: Properties file that can be provided, which may contain VxStream internal directives (e.g. ‘actionScript’)
parameters.description: (Optional) Properties that can be associated with the submitted file. Properties might contain VxStream internal directives, such as, actionScript.

parameters.title: Comment
parameters.name: comment
parameters.tooltip: Comment text that may be associated with the submission/sample (Note: you can use #tags here)
parameters.description: (Optional) A comment that you want to add when submitting the file.

parameters.title: Custom Date Time for the Analysis System
parameters.name: custom_date_time
parameters.tooltip: Custom date/time that can be set for the analysis system
parameters.description: (Optional) The Custom date and time that you can set for the analysis system.

parameters.title: Custom CMD Line Pass to the Analysis File
parameters.name: custom_cmd_line
parameters.tooltip: Commandline that should be passed to the analysis file
parameters.description: (Optional) The custom command line that you want to pass to the analysis file.

parameters.title: Custom Run Time
parameters.name: custom_run_time
parameters.tooltip: Runtime duration (in seconds)
parameters.description: (Optional) The runtime duration that you can specify in seconds.

parameters.title: Submit Name
parameters.name: submit_name
parameters.tooltip: Submission Name field that will be used for file type detection and analysis
parameters.description: (Optional) The name of the submitted file. The Submission Name field is used for file type detection and analysis.

parameters.title: Document Password
parameters.name: document_password
parameters.tooltip: Document password that will be used to fill-in Adobe/Office password prompts
parameters.description: (Optional) The password of the document is used to fill in Adobe or Office password prompts.

parameters.title: Environment Variable (Format name=value)
parameters.name: environment_variable
parameters.tooltip: System environment value. The value is provided in the format: name=value
parameters.description: (Optional) The system environment value. You must provide this value in the name=value format.

operations.title: Submit URL
operations.description: Submits a URL to the Hybrid Analysis server for analysis.

parameters.title: URL
parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Specify the URL that you want to submit to the Hybrid Analysis server.

parameters.title: Environment ID
parameters.name: environment_id
parameters.tooltip: e.g 300: 'Linux (Ubuntu 16.04, 64 bit)', 200: 'Android Static Analysis’
parameters.description:
The ID of the environment in which the URL is to be run.
For example, 300: 'Linux (Ubuntu 16.04, 64 bit)', 200: 'Android Static Analysis’.
Available environment IDs are: 300: 'Linux (Ubuntu 16.04, 64 bit)', 200: 'Android Static Analysis’, 120: 'Windows 7 64 bit’, 110: 'Windows 7 32 bit (HWP Support)', or 100: ‘Windows 7 32 bit’.

parameters.title: Do Not Share with Third Party?
parameters.name: no_share_third_party
parameters.tooltip: When set to true, the sample is never shared with any third party
parameters.description: If you select this option, i.e set it to, True, then this sample is not shared with any third-party.By default, this is set to, False.

parameters.title: Do Not Lookup with Hash?
parameters.name: no_hash_lookup
parameters.tooltip: When set to true, we can not lookup with hash
parameters.description: If you select this option, i.e set it to,True then this sample is not looked up using its hashvalue.By default, this is set to, False.

parameters.title: Priority
parameters.name: priority
parameters.tooltip: Priority value between 1 (default) and 10 (highest)
parameters.description: (Optional) The priority value of the sample URL. By default, all URL samples are set to run with the highest priority i.e., 100. You can set this value to any value between 1 (lowest) and 100(highest).

parameters.title: Action Script
parameters.name: action_script
parameters.tooltip: Custom runtime action script. Available runtime scripts are following
parameters.description: (Optional) Select a custom runtime action script.Available custom runtime action script are as follows: default, default_maxantievasion, default_randomfiles, default_randomtheme, or default_openie.

parameters.title: Required Memory Dump?
parameters.name: hybrid_analysis
parameters.tooltip: When set to 'false’, no memory dumps or memory dump analysis will take place
parameters.description: If you select this option, i.e set it to,True then memory dumps or memory analysis dumps will occur.By default, this is set to, True.

parameters.title: Experimental Anti-Evasion?
parameters.name: experimental_anti_evasion
parameters.tooltip: When set to true, will set all experimental anti-evasion options of the kernelmode Monitor
parameters.description: If you select this option, i.e set it to, True,enables all the experimental anti-evasion options of the kernelmode Monitor.By default, this is set toFalse

parameters.title: Set the IN-Depth Script Logging
parameters.name: script_logging
parameters.tooltip: When set to true, will set the in-depth script logging engine of the kernelmode Monitor
parameters.description: If you select this option, i.e set it to,True enables the in-depth script logging engine of the kernelmode Monitor.By default, this is set to, False.

parameters.title: Allow Sample Tampering
parameters.name: input_sample_tampering
parameters.tooltip: When set to true, will allow experimental anti-evasion options of the kernelmode Monitor that tamper with the input sample
parameters.description: If you select this option, i.e set it to,True enables the experimental anti-evasion options of the kernelmode Monitor that tamper with the input sample.By default, this is set to, False.

parameters.title: Enabled TOR Analysis?
parameters.name: tor_enabled_analysis
parameters.tooltip: When set to true, will route the network traffic for the analysis via TOR (if properly configured on the server)
parameters.description: If you select this option, i.e set it to, True, the network traffic for the analysis is routed using TOR (if it is properly configured on the server.By default, this is set to, True.

parameters.title: Email Notification
parameters.name: email
parameters.tooltip: E-Mail address that may be associated with the submission for notification
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the email addresses that are associated with the URL that you have submitted for analysis. This email address will be used for notification purposes.

parameters.title: Comment
parameters.name: comment
parameters.tooltip:
(Optional) A comment that you want to add when submitting the URL.
Note: You can use #tags while entering comments.

parameters.title: Custom Date Time for the Analysis System
parameters.name: custom_date_time
parameters.tooltip: Custom date/time that can be set for the analysis system
parameters.description: (Optional) The Custom date and time that you can set for the analysis system.

parameters.title: Custom Run Time
parameters.name: custom_run_time
parameters.tooltip: Runtime duration (in seconds)
parameters.description: (Optional) The runtime duration that you can specify in seconds.

parameters.title: Environment Variable (Format name=value)
parameters.name: environment_variable
parameters.tooltip: System environment value. The value is provided in the format: name=value
parameters.description: (Optional) The system environment value. You must provide this value in the name=value format.

operations.title: Quick Scan URL
operations.description: Submits a URL to the Hybrid Analysis server for a Quick Scan. You can query the Hybrid Analysis server again, in a few minutes, to check the results of the scan.

parameters.title: URL
parameters.name: url_to_scan
parameters.tooltip: The URL you want to scan
parameters.description: Specify URL that you want to scan in Hybrid Analysis server for analyzes.

parameters.title: Do Not Share with Third Party?
parameters.name: no_share_third_party
parameters.tooltip: When set to true, the sample is never shared with any third party
parameters.description:
If you select this option, i.e. set it to True; then this sample URL is not shared with any third party.
By default, this is set to, False.

parameters.title: Allow Community Access?
parameters.name: allow_community_access
parameters.tooltip: If you select this option, i.e set it to,True the sample will be available for the community.By default, this is set to, True. Note: When 'Do Not Share with Third Party?' is set to 'False', it won't be possible to set different value than 'True'
parameters.description:
If you select this option, i.e. set it to True; then this sample URL is available for the community. By default, this is set to, True.
Note: When the 'Do Not Share with Third Party?' option is set to 'False', then this option must be set as True, i.e., it is not possible to set a value other than 'True'.

operations.title: Get Analysis Report
operations.description: Retrieves all the analysis details from the Hybrid Analysis server for a submitted file, based on the input parameters you specify.

parameters.title: Job ID
parameters.name: job_id
parameters.tooltip: ID of the file for which you want to retrieve a report from the Hybrid Analysis server. You can get the job ID when you submit a sample file. Note: If you provide Job ID then no need to provide File SHA256 and Environment ID
parameters.description:
The ID of the file for which you want to retrieve a report from the Hybrid Analysis server. You can get the job ID when you submit a sample file.
Note: If you specify the Job ID you do not require to specify File SHA256 or the environment ID.

parameters.title: File SHA256
parameters.name: file_hash
parameters.tooltip: SHA256 value of the file for which you want to retrieve a report from the Hybrid Analysis server. You can get the SHA256 value when you submit a sample file. Note: If you provide File SHA256 then you should provide Environment ID and no need to provide Job ID.
parameters.description:
SHA256 value of the file for which you want to retrieve a report from the Hybrid Analysis server. You can get the SHA256 value when you submit a sample file.
Note: If you specify File SHA256, then you must specify the Environment ID.

parameters.title: Environment ID
parameters.name: environmentId
parameters.tooltip: ID of the environment on which the submitted file is to be run, whose report you want to retrieve from the Hybrid Analysis server. You can get the Environment ID when you submit a sample file. Note: If you provide Environment ID then you should provide File SHA256 and no need to provide Job ID
parameters.description:
The ID of the environment on which the submitted file is to be run, whose report you want to retrieve from the Hybrid Analysis server. You can get the Environment ID when you submit a sample file.
Note: If you specify Environment ID, then you must specify the File SHA256.

operations.title: Advanced Search
operations.description: Retrieves all the reports from the Hybrid Analysis server that match the input parameters you specify.

parameters.title: File Name
parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: Name of the file based on which you want to search for a report on the Hybrid Analysis server.

parameters.title: File Type
parameters.name: filetype
parameters.description: Type of the file based on which you want to search for a report on the Hybrid Analysis server.

parameters.title: File Type Description
parameters.name: filetype_desc
parameters.description: Description of the file type based on which you want to search for a report on the Hybrid Analysis server.

parameters.title: Verdict
parameters.name: verdict
parameters.description: Verdict of the Hybrid Analysis server after scanning the submitted file. Select one of the following as the verdict value: Whitelisted, No Verdict, No Specific Threat, Suspicious, or Malicious.

parameters.title: AV Multiscan range
parameters.name: av_detect
parameters.description: AV Multiscan range of the file based on which you want to search for a report on the Hybrid Analysis server.

parameters.title: AV Family Substring
parameters.name: vx_family
parameters.description: AV Family Substring of the file type based on which you want to search for a report on the Hybrid Analysis server.

parameters.title: Hash Tag
parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Hash tag of the file based on which you want to search for a report on the Hybrid Analysis server.

parameters.title: Port
parameters.name: port
parameters.description: Port of the file based on which you want to search for a report on the Hybrid Analysis server.

parameters.title: Host
parameters.name: host
parameters.description: Host of the file based on which you want to search for a report on the Hybrid Analysis server.

parameters.title: Domain
parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: Domain of the file based on which you want to search for a report on the Hybrid Analysis server.

parameters.title: HTTP Request Substring
parameters.name: url
parameters.description: HTTP Request Substring of the file based on which you want to search for a report on the Hybrid Analysis server.

parameters.title: Similar Samples
parameters.name: similar_to
parameters.description: Samples that are similar to the submitted file that you want to search for a report on the Hybrid Analysis server. For example, files having a similar SHA value.

parameters.title: Sample Context
parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Samples that have a similar context to the submitted file that you want to search for a report on the Hybrid Analysis server.

parameters.title: IMP Hash
parameters.name: imp_hash
parameters.description: IMP Hash of the file based on which you want to search for a report on the Hybrid Analysis server.

parameters.title: SS Deep
parameters.name: ssdeep
parameters.description: SS Deep of the file based on which you want to search for a report on the Hybrid Analysis server.

parameters.title: Authenti Hash
parameters.name: authentihash
parameters.description: Authentihash of the file based on which you want to search for a report on the Hybrid Analysis server.

operations.title: Get Files Dropped by Sample
operations.description: Retrieves all the details of the dropped file from the Hybrid Analysis server and adds the file to the FortiSOAR™ Attachments module. You specify the sample for which you want to retrieve dropped files, based on the input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Job ID
parameters.name: job_id
parameters.tooltip: ID of the file for which you want to retrieve a report from the Hybrid Analysis server. You can get the job ID when you submit a sample file. Note: If you provide Job ID then no need to provide File SHA256 and Environment ID
parameters.description:
The ID of the file for which you want to retrieve details of the dropped file from the Hybrid Analysis server. You can get the job ID when you submit a sample file.
Note: If you specify the Job ID you do not require to specify File SHA256 or the environment ID.

parameters.title: File SHA256
parameters.name: file_hash
parameters.tooltip: SHA256 value of the file for which you want to retrieve a report from the Hybrid Analysis server. You can get the SHA256 value when you submit a sample file. Note: If you provide File SHA256 then you should provide Environment ID and no need to provide Job ID.
parameters.description:
SHA256 value of the file for which you want to retrieve details of the dropped file from the Hybrid Analysis server. You can get the SHA256 value when you submit a sample file.
Note: If you specify File SHA256, then you must specify the Environment ID.

parameters.title: Environment ID
parameters.name: environmentId
parameters.tooltip: ID of the environment on which the submitted file is to be run, whose report you want to retrieve from the Hybrid Analysis server. You can get the Environment ID when you submit a sample file. Note: If you provide Environment ID then you should provide File SHA256 and no need to provide Job ID
parameters.description:
The ID of the environment on which the submitted file is to be run, whose details of the dropped file you want to retrieve from the Hybrid Analysis server. You can get the Environment ID when you submit a sample file.
Note: If you specify Environment ID, then you must specify the File SHA256.

operations.title: Get Sample Screenshot
operations.description: Retrieves screenshots of specified submitted samples that are captured during analysis from the Hybrid Analysis server. You specify the sample for which you want to retrieve screenshots based on the input parameters you have specified. You can optionally also add the screenshots to the FortiSOAR™ Attachments module.

parameters.title: Job ID
parameters.name: job_id
parameters.tooltip: ID of the file for which you want to retrieve a report from the Hybrid Analysis server. You can get the job ID when you submit a sample file. Note: If you provide Job ID then no need to provide File SHA256 and Environment ID
parameters.description:
The ID of the file for which you want to retrieve screenshots that are captured during analysis from the Hybrid Analysis server. You can get the job ID when you submit a sample file.
Note: If you specify the Job ID you do not require to specify File SHA256 or the environment ID.

parameters.title: File SHA256
parameters.name: file_hash
parameters.tooltip: SHA256 value of the file for which you want to retrieve a report from the Hybrid Analysis server. You can get the SHA256 value when you submit a sample file. Note: If you provide File SHA256 then you should provide Environment ID and no need to provide Job ID.
parameters.description:
SHA256 value of the file for which you want to retrieve screenshots that are captured during analysis from the Hybrid Analysis server. You can get the SHA256 value when you submit a sample file.
Note: If you specify File SHA256, then you must specify the Environment ID.

parameters.title: Environment ID
parameters.name: environmentId
parameters.tooltip: ID of the environment on which the submitted file is to be run, whose report you want to retrieve from the Hybrid Analysis server. You can get the Environment ID when you submit a sample file. Note: If you provide Environment ID then you should provide File SHA256 and no need to provide Job ID
parameters.description:
The ID of the environment on which the submitted file is to be run, whose screenshots you want to retrieve from the Hybrid Analysis server. You can get the Environment ID when you submit a sample file.
Note: If you specify Environment ID, then you must specify the File SHA256.

parameters.title: Attach Screenshots to FortiSOAR
parameters.name: is_attach
parameters.description:
If you select this option, i.e. set it to True, then the sample screenshots are added to the FortiSOAR™ Attachments module.
By default, this is set to, False.

operations.title: Get Submission State
operations.description: Retrieves the state of a submitted file from the Hybrid Analysis server, based on the input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Job ID
parameters.name: job_id
parameters.tooltip: ID of the file for which you want to retrieve a report from the Hybrid Analysis server. You can get the job ID when you submit a sample file. Note: If you provide Job ID then no need to provide File SHA256 and Environment ID
parameters.description:
The ID of the submitted file for which you want to retrieve the state information from the Hybrid Analysis server. You can get the job ID when you submit a sample file.
Note: If you specify the Job ID you do not require to specify File SHA256 or the environment ID.

parameters.title: File SHA256
parameters.name: file_hash
parameters.tooltip: SHA256 value of the file for which you want to retrieve a report from the Hybrid Analysis server. You can get the SHA256 value when you submit a sample file. Note: If you provide File SHA256 then you should provide Environment ID and no need to provide Job ID.
parameters.description:
SHA256 value of the submitted file for which you want to retrieve the state information from the Hybrid Analysis server. You can get the SHA256 value when you submit a sample file.
Note: If you specify File SHA256, then you must specify the Environment ID.

parameters.title: Environment ID
parameters.name: environmentId
parameters.tooltip: ID of the environment on which the submitted file is to be run, whose report you want to retrieve from the Hybrid Analysis server. You can get the Environment ID when you submit a sample file. Note: If you provide Environment ID then you should provide File SHA256 and no need to provide Job ID
parameters.description:
The ID of the environment on which the submitted file is to be run, whose state information you want to retrieve from the Hybrid Analysis server. You can get the Environment ID when you submit a sample file.
Note: If you specify Environment ID, then you must specify the File SHA256.

operations.title: Get Latest Analysis Reports
operations.description: Retrieves a list of reports from the Hybrid Analysis server, based on the number of days you have specified.

operations.title: Get API Quota
operations.description: Retrieves details of the API quota for the specified user account from the Hybrid Analysis server. You specify the user account when you are configuring the Hybrid Analysis connector.
